chapter.title: Architecture of the EngSB
chapter.para: Since this manual is the user manual only a very basic overview over the architecture should be given. For more detailed overview use the own architectural manual also provided at openengsb.org.

section.title: Connectors
section.para: Actually there are two different kinds of connectors - internal and external ones. Internal connectors are directly implemented into the OpenEngSB and could be used to access external tools or be able to embed tools completely into the OpenEngSB. Differently external connectors are written outside of the OpenEngSB. This requires them to be available from the bus and to communicate with the bus. Both ways of communication have to be established via an external protocol, since the internal communication module could not be used. Since most connectors not directly produced by the OpenEngSB team or contributors will be external connectors we will start with them.

section.title: Connector Domains
section.para: Although engineering systems could be a very complex system nevertheless all engineering teams are using the same tools throughout all their work. Nevertheless how complex such an infrastructure is you'll always find an Issue Tracker, a SCM and so on. Therefore it is possible to define base messages and base systems for all of them. At the moment the following types are designed and avaialble (or in a short period of time).
The following chapters describe each of these types, what the developer of the EngSB thought about them and what type of events they allow and why.
